title: [IOTDB-6094] Load: Fix error in if/else judgment of tsfileResource exists or not & Reduce warn log when timeseries exist
body: ## Description In a benchmark scenario with 500 devices and 50 sensors, the load gives a No Such File error. ## Reason `constructTsFileResource` only update the tsfile resource information and does not create a file, then every time it determines whether the file exists, causes it to go to the wrong branch and add resource to LoadTsfileStatement wrongly and repeatedly. As a result, multiple identical tsfile resources are stored in the `resources` of `LoadTsFileStatement`.After loading the file once, it will be deleted in tmp dir and NoSuchFileException will be reported in the subsequent load. constructTsFileResource 只会更新tsfileResource而不会创建一个新文件，导致每次对tsfile resource 逻辑判断是否存在该文件时会走入错误的分支而重复添加该 tsfile resource到 LoadTsfileStatement 中。在第一次load后，存储在临时文件夹里的tsfile会被删掉，而导致后续重复的load找不到这个文件而报错 NoSuchFIleException.

title: Fix recover last flush time map bug
body:
## Description

When recover the last flush time map from two sequence TsFiles. 
 * TsFile A only contains device1 with end time = 10000
 * TsFile B only contains device2 with end time = 9999

And the resources of these two TsFiles have been downgrade to FileTimeIndex.

The previous code will use TsFile B with end time = 9999 to recover the last flush time of device1, which would cause sequence files overlapped.

title: Totally fix the python client IT issues
body:
## Description

This PR is fixing the following issues.

1. The consensus_protocol settings was invalid previously, this pr fixed it
2. When IT meets error, the log of DataNode can be printed out
3. The Python Client IT failed sometimes, the reason is when execute SchemaRegion creation, the confignode has not get the dataNode heartbeat before. Therefore, we need to add some sleep before execute the tests.

title: [To rel/1.2] add hot load compaction configs
body:
## Description
Four compaction configs support hot-load.
1. compaction_validation_level
2. enable_seq_space_compaction
3. enable_unseq_space_compaction
4. enable_cross_space_compaction
5. compaction_thread_count
6. sub_compaction_thread_count

title: Add hot load compaction configs

1. compaction_validation_level
2. enable_seq_space_compaction
3. enable_unseq_space_compaction
4. enable_cross_space_compaction
5. compaction_thread_count

[IOTDB-6084] Pipe: Support node-urls (client HA) in iotdb-thrift-connector-v1(v2)
body:
* Allows the connector to send data to multiple target nodes separately, allowing continued transmission of data with only one node (connection) alive.

* Support for automatic switch to different target nodes when a connection dies, support for automatic biopsy and recovery of node connections.

title: [To rel/1.2][IOTDB-6079] Cluster computing resource balance
body: cherry-pick [pull](https://github.com/apache/iotdb/pull/10648)

title: [To rel/1.2][IOTDB-6079] Cluster computing resource balance
body:
**Before Updation:**

Users could only either turn on the inherit policy to speed up queries or abandon the inherit policy for better DataPartition load balancing.

**After Updation:**

Now users don't need to care the inherit policy. The cluster will decide the best DataPartition allocation while pay attention to both the inherit policy and load balance.

You can see our detailed algorithm design at the [Partition Allocation Doc](https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/EEjVdil7hoeRRAxYOQScNyTPnoc)

title: [To rel/1.2]Enhance versionInfo in show cluster and show cluster detail
body: cherry-pick [pull](https://github.com/apache/iotdb/pull/10743)

title: Enhance versionInfo in show cluster and show cluster detail
Cleaned up in the projects maven configuration
body:
After the refactoring of the project by grouping together projects in subdirectories, the maven build didn't reflect this change.

This PR introduces intermediate parent poms for each of these new module groups.

The java related profiles had the problem of not activating on Java 20. So I changed the version range to be open-ended, so we don't need to update the version range every time a new Java version is released.

I also renamed some of the profiles:

In general self-activating profile (such as OS detection, Java-Version , Thrift-Generation) are now all prefixed with a "." to indicate these are not meant to be manually activated or deactivated.
Profiles adding new modules to the reactor, I renamed to "with-{xyz}"
I would propose to rename profiles customizing the build with something like "option-{xyz}" (like "option-get-jar-with-dependencies")
When reviewing the pom content of many projects, I noticed a lot of the configuration (especially the cpp stuff) was mainly copied (I guess from PLC4X' build) Many design assumptions I did in PLC4X however don't apply to IoTDB. I cleaned up the maven config for these parts quite dramatically and hereby greatly simplified things.

Also did I notice that the project contains a number of dependency loops, such as:

client-cpp needs deployment for running tests
deployment bundles client-cpp
This is the main reason you can't run a maven build with tests if you've just checked it out or run clean on the project.

This PR resolves all of these issues, except the logical cycle of depending on "distribution", as I'd like to address that by introducing a "test-server" module, that runs IoTDB locally and inside the current modules target directory.

There are more dependencies in the projects, which are not modeled in a Maven way and Maven therefore can't know about them. Especially, in the cpp modules, the CMakeLists.txt or the poms quite regularly use paths, that navigate outside of the current module to copy things from other maven modules.

Also did I have quite a lot of problems running the build on my ARM64 Mac (M2) in any of our supported OSes (Mac, Linux, Windows). I worked hard on getting the build to run on all of these:

Linux-x86_64
Linux-aarch64
Mac-x86_64
Mac-aarch64
Windows-x86_64
Windows-aarch64
(Currently building the cpp-client in windows is still a bit of a Work-in-Progress, Thrift however builds nicely)
The thrift compiler module in "iotdb-client" furned out to also be needed in all protocol modules, where we use the thrift compiler to compile the Thrift specs (Even if we used a download from our second git repo to hide that dependency). I moved that part to a "tools" directory in the root of the project. I would however propose to move this part into a separate repository, as it actually doesn't have even the slightest thing to do with IoTDB. As some modules were not only depending on the executable, but also the shared libraries and the header files, I refactored that module to produce an assembly containing all of this with a classifier for each supported hardware and os platform we support.

title: Cleaned up in the projects maven configuration
body:
## Description

After the refactoring of the project by grouping together projects in subdirectories, the maven build didn't reflect this change. 

This PR introduces intermediate parent poms for each of these new module groups.

The java related profiles had the problem of not activating on Java 20. So I changed the version range to be open-ended, so we don't need to update the version range every time a new Java version is released.

I also renamed some of the profiles:
- In general self-activating profile (such as OS detection, Java-Version , Thrift-Generation) are now all prefixed with a "." to indicate these are not meant to be manually activated or deactivated.
- Profiles adding new modules to the reactor, I renamed to "with-{xyz}"
- I would propose to rename profiles customizing the build with something like "option-{xyz}" (like "option-get-jar-with-dependencies")

When reviewing the pom content of many projects, I noticed a lot of the configuration (especially the cpp stuff) was mainly copied (I guess from PLC4X' build) Many design assumptions I did in PLC4X however don't apply to IoTDB. I cleaned up the maven config for these parts quite dramatically and hereby greatly simplified things.

Also did I notice that the project contains a number of dependency loops, such as:
- client-cpp needs deployment for running tests
- deployment bundles client-cpp

This is the main reason you can't run a maven build with tests if you've just checked it out or run clean on the project.

This PR resolves all of these issues, except the logical cycle of depending on "distribution", as I'd like to address that by introducing a "test-server" module, that runs IoTDB locally and inside the current modules target directory.

There are more dependencies in the projects, which are not modeled in a Maven way and Maven therefore can't know about them. Especially, in the cpp modules, the CMakeLists.txt or the poms quite regularly use paths, that navigate outside of the current module to copy things from other maven modules. 

Also did I have quite a lot of problems running the build on my ARM64 Mac (M2) in any of our supported OSes (Mac, Linux, Windows). I worked hard on getting the build to run on all of these:
- Linux-x86_64
- Linux-aarch64
- Mac-x86_64
- Mac-aarch64
- Windows-x86_64
- Windows-aarch64
(Currently building the cpp-client in windows is still a bit of a Work-in-Progress, Thrift however builds nicely)

The thrift compiler module in "iotdb-client" furned out to also be needed in all protocol modules, where we use the thrift compiler to compile the Thrift specs (Even if we used a download from our second git repo to hide that dependency). I moved that part to a "tools" directory in the root of the project. I would however propose to move this part into a separate repository, as it actually doesn't have even the slightest thing to do with IoTDB. As some modules were not only depending on the executable, but also the shared libraries and the header files, I refactored that module to produce an assembly containing all of this with a classifier for each supported hardware and os platform we support.

title: [To rel/1.2] Disable some pipe extractor's features due to unstability
body:
The following parameters are NOT ready for production use. This commit removes the entry of use.

```
'pipe.realtime.mode' = 'log',
'pipe.realtime.mode' = 'hybrid'
```

title: [To rel/1.2] Remove unnecessary metrics and optimize allocation byte counting
body: cherry pick #10738

title: Remove unnecessary metrics and optimize allocation byte counting
body:
1. Remove `jvm_gc_old_gc_count` and `jvm_gc_young_gc_count`
2. Remove `jvm_gc_memory_used_percent`
3. Fix `isYoungGenPool()`, removing survivors
4. Combine `jvm_gc_pause` and `jvm_gc_concurrent_phase_time` into one metric
5. Adjust the calculation of the `jvm_gc_memory_allocated_bytes` metric into three new metrics: young gen memory, old gen memory, and non-gen memory, making it possible to calculate allocations for large objects

body:
## IOTDB-6089
Changes:
1. Will not acquire the lock if the pipe heartbeat is separated from cluster heartbeat.
2. Set timeOut of the acquisition of the lock if pipe heartbeat is joined with cluster heartbeat.

title: [IOTDB-6088] Load: Optimize the schema creation process & Avoid OOM and ratis createMultiTimeseriesPlan bufferSize too large
body:
## Description
The load phase loads all the schemas of one device into memory at once, which causes createMultiTimeseries to be too large when the amount of tsfile is huge.
![image](https://github.com/apache/iotdb/assets/42286868/b9a99736-47c2-4291-a2b7-ad288f4cc35f)

## Solution
1. granularity changed from `devices` to `timeseries`
2. set threshold to limit the number of timeseries when creating a schema once
3. add logger to show the load progress info

title: [IOTDB-6089] Improved the lock behaviour of the pipe heartbeat to avoid causing DataNode unknown
body:
## IOTDB-6089
Changes:
1. Will not acquire the lock if the pipe heartbeat is separated from cluster heartbeat.
2. Set timeOut of the acquisition of the lock if pipe heartbeat is joined with cluster heartbeat.

title: [To rel/1.1] Add compression and encoding type check for FastCompactionPerformer #10712
body: Same as PR https://github.com/apache/iotdb/pull/10712

title: [To rel/1.2] Add compression and encoding type check for FastCompactionPerformer
body: ## Description In FastCompactionPerformer, there is no logic to judge whether the CompressionType or TsEncodingType are same or not between two candidate chunk, which will lead to a false case that there are two pages whose compression type are different in one Chunk. This PR is used to fix this issue. That is, when dealing with chunks whose compression type are different, decode all points and compact them into a new chunk rather than copy page directly

title: build: Cleaned up the poms to match the new directory structure
body:
## Description

Even if the directory structure is a lot cleaner now, still the structure of the maven reactor was flat. 
By inserting intermediate parent poms in each of the subdirectories and adjusting the parent relation, now the project should be nicely structured in Maven enabled IDEs.

I also streamlined the profiles as some were duplicates and moved the integration-test module execution into a separate "with-integration-test" profile as it's execution takes unreasonably long and should probably not be run locally.

title: [To rel/1.2] [IOTDB-6090] add memory estimator on inner space compaction
body:
## Description
For in-space merge, the memory evaluation process is added. At the beginning of task execution, the system evaluates the memory size of the task to determine whether the evaluation result is smaller than the configured maximum memory size. If the evaluation result is smaller than the configured maximum memory size, the task can be executed normally. Added two memory estimators, the ReadChunkEstimator and the FastCompactionEstimator, which will be used when performer of the merge task is ReadChunk. Otherwise, use FastCompactionEstimator
see https://github.com/apache/iotdb/pull/10688

body: Currently, connector-v1 only supports ip and port, while connector-v2 only supports node-urls. We should make connector-v1 and v2 support both ip & port and node-urls.

title: Update Jenkinsfile and ignore sonar check on Jenkins
Add compression and encoding type check for FastCompactionPerformer
body: ## Description In FastCompactionPerformer, there is no logic to judge whether the CompressionType or TsEncodingType are same or not between two candidate chunk, which will lead to a false case that there are two pages whose compression type are different in one Chunk. This PR is used to fix this issue. That is, when dealing with chunks whose compression type are different, decode all points and compact them into a new chunk rather than copy page directly

title: [To rel/1.2] add memory estimator on inner space compaction
body:
## Description
For in-space merge, the memory evaluation process is added. At the beginning of task execution, the system evaluates the memory size of the task to determine whether the evaluation result is smaller than the configured maximum memory size. If the evaluation result is smaller than the configured maximum memory size, the task can be executed normally. Added two memory estimators, the ReadChunkEstimator and the FastCompactionEstimator, which will be used when performer of the merge task is ReadChunk. Otherwise, use FastCompactionEstimator
see https://github.com/apache/iotdb/pull/10688

title: [IOTDB-6083] Pipe: make PipeRawTabletInsertionEvent able to report progress to avoid losing data
body: Currently, only events that extends EnrichedEvent can report progresses and failures, but PipeRawTabletInsertionEvent does not extend EnrichedEvent, which may lose data when failure occurs. This PR makes PipeRawTabletInsertionEvent extend EnrichedEvent to enable reporting progresses and failures.

title: [To rel/1.1] Fix potential memory leak in MemoryPool
body: Similar to https://github.com/apache/iotdb/pull/10687

title: add memory estimator on inner space compaction
body: For in-space merge, the memory evaluation process is added. At the beginning of task execution, the system evaluates the memory size of the task to determine whether the evaluation result is smaller than the configured maximum memory size. If the evaluation result is smaller than the configured maximum memory size, the task can be executed normally. Added two memory estimators, the `ReadChunkEstimator` and the `FastCompactionEstimator`, which will be used when performer of the merge task is ReadChunk. Otherwise, use FastCompactionEstimator

title: Fix potential memory leak in MemoryPool
body: If we do not add syncronized on the future of MemoryPool.tryCancel(), it may lead to memory leak like this: When close method of SharedTsBlockQueue is invoked, it will update bufferRetainedSizeInBytes using the value returned by tryCancel because if the MemoryReservationFuture is not completed, it means that the size of TsBlock is added wrongly.(Memory used by that TsBlock is not registered in MemoryPool since reserving memory failed) However, it's possible that the MemoryReservationFuture is completed by MemoryPool.free concurrently and then the free method registers the TsBlock in MemoryPool while tryCancel still returns the size of TsBlock, leading to remaining records in the MemoryReservationMap.

title: [To rel/1.2] factor the mods file size into the cross-space merge memory estimate
body: In the existing memory estimation method, the memory estimation required for seq files,unSeq files, and target files is estimated respectively. The mods file size of the source file is not factored into the memory estimate. This optimization takes the mods file size into account in memory estimates. See the documentation for details: https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/UTkZd9ynbo99o6xuzNVc90wlnxg

title: [To rel/1.2] fix inaccurate statistics for monitoring the number of unseq Tsfile on cross compaction
body: When an exception occurs in the execution of a cross-space task, when some source files exist and all target files have been generated, the system will decide to delete the remaining source files. When the source files are deleted, the number of files in the monitoring system is not updated, and it should be updated

body: [To rel/1.1]Add sorting based on timestamps to the insertTable method in the rest API v1/v2

title: [To rel/1.2][IOTDB-6081] Pipe: use HybridExtractor instead of LogExtractor when realtime mode is set to log to avoid OOM under heavy insertion load
body:
* When user specifies 'extractor.realtime.mode'='log', we use hybrid extractors which can automatically degrade to file mode when load is too heavy.

* Add a parameter: 'extractor.realtime.mode'='forced-log', the pipe will always use log mode and will never degrade to file mode.

---------

Co-authored-by: Steve Yurong Su <rong@apache.org>
(cherry picked from commit 01378cc91b0a4349f8a714754f82054ec9b425fb)

title: [To rel/1.1] Add time partition in compaction comparator
body:
## Description
Add time partition in compaction comparator.
If the time partition of two tasks are different. We prefer to execute task with greater time partition because we want to compact files with new data.
